title: Zohran Mamdani Enlists â€˜Survivorâ€™ Contestants in Anti-Cuomo Campaign Ad: â€˜Andrew, Weâ€™re Voting You Off the Island and Back to the Suburbsâ€™
description:
The tribe has spokenâ€¦ and theyâ€™re voting Andrew Cuomo off the island.

	Several recent â€œSurvivorâ€ contestants â€” including Teeny Chirichillo (Season
body:
The tribe has spokenâ€¦ and theyâ€™re voting Andrew Cuomo off the island.

	Several recent â€œSurvivorâ€ contestants â€” including Teeny Chirichillo (Season 47), Yam Yam Arocho (Season 44) and Katurah Topps (Season 45) â€” have returned to tribal council to advocate for Zohran Mamdani in a new campaign advertisement paid for by the New York City mayoral candidate.

	The spot, which aired during Wednesday nightâ€™s episode of â€œSurvivor,â€ is one of several in a seven-figure ad buy to reach different demographics of the voting public. Mamdaniâ€™s campaign ran a â€œBachelorâ€-inspired adÂ during a recent episode of â€œThe Golden Bachelor.â€
	

	â€œAndrew, New Yorkers want a mayor who will make groceries and childcare affordable, not sell us out to their billionaire donors,â€ Chirichillo says in the ad while holding up a piece of the showâ€™s signature voting parchment with Cuomoâ€™s name on it, as if voting him out of the race.


	In a spin on the confessionals shown during â€œSurvivorâ€ elimination ceremonies, Brandon Donlon (Season 45) pushes for â€œa mayor who will make buses fast and free,â€ while Arocho hopes to elect someone who will â€œnot defund the MTA.â€

	Before Cuomoâ€™s fictional torch is snuffed out, Natalie Anderson (Season 29) makes a final plea: â€œWeâ€™re with assemblyman Zohran Mamdani. Heâ€™ll stand up to Trump, freeze the rent and deliver universal childcare.â€

	Mamdani appears at the end of the spot to conclude: â€œWeâ€™re going to build a city where no one has to struggle to survive.â€

	Mamdani, a 33-year-old Democratic Socialist and state assemblyman whose progressive economic platform has galvanized younger voters, won the Democratic primary in a stunning upset. He and his rivals â€” former Gov. Cuomo, running as an independent, and Curtis Sliwa, the Republican nominee â€” are expected to spend millions of advertising dollars ahead of the mayoral election on Nov. 4.Â

schema.headline: Zohran Mamdani Enlists â€˜Survivorâ€™ Contestants in Anti-Cuomo Campaign Ad: â€˜Andrew, Weâ€™re Voting You Off the Island and Back to the Suburbsâ€™

title: Woman Dies in Apparent Suicide at Disney Worldâ€™s Contemporary Resort
description: A woman died in an â€œapparent suicideâ€ on Tuesday outside Disney Worldâ€˜s Contemporary Resort in Florida, according to the Orange County Sheriffâ€™s Off
body:
A woman died in an â€œapparent suicideâ€ on Tuesday outside Disney Worldâ€˜s Contemporary Resort in Florida, according to the Orange County Sheriffâ€™s Office.

	â€œWe can confirm this was an apparent suicide,â€ a spokesperson for the Orange County Sheriffâ€™s Office told Variety in an email.

	The suicideâ€™s proximity to the famous Disney World monorail sparked unconfirmed reports online about the cause of death. However, a spokesperson from the Orange County Sheriffâ€™s Office told People that the victim was â€œNOT struck by the monorail,â€ and deemed any reports suggesting she was â€œerroneous information.â€
	

	Local outlet WKMG reported that local authorities received word around 6:40 p.m. local time about a body on North World Dive, which runs through Disneyâ€™s Contemporary Resort.


	A video by an onlooker posted online showed employees erecting a white pop-up tent on the terrace of the Contemporary Resort in the wake of the incident. Police cars can be seen congregating in the parking lot below.

	Originally opened in October 1971 as the Tempo Bay Hotel, the Contemporary Resort is one of the two original residences built at the Disney World Complex. On the Disney World website, the hotel is described as an â€œultra-modernâ€ lodging featuring the â€œiconic A-frame Contemporary towerâ€ and a â€œ90-foot-tall mural by Disney Legend Mary Blair â€” responsible for the distinct look and feel of the â€˜itâ€™s a small worldâ€™ attraction.â€

	The suicide comes a week after a woman in her 60s experienced a health issue and died after riding Disneylandâ€™s Haunted Mansion attraction in California. Anaheim Police confirmed that the woman was unresponsive after exiting the ride, and that Disneyland security administered CPR until first responders rushed her to the hospital. She was later pronounced dead.

schema.headline: Woman Dies in Apparent Suicide at Disney Worldâ€™s Contemporary Resort

body:
As we enter the first week of October, the past few weeks have been filled with blockbusters and independent films for audiences to discover. From films about a mysterious ringing phone to decade spanning love stories, this season is full of blockbusters and independent film for everyone to watch on the big screen for the next few weeks.Â 

	The first wide release of this week will be Universalâ€™s â€œBlack Phone 2,â€ starring Ethan Hawke and Mason Thames. The film follows â€œ5-year-old Gwen as she receives calls from the black phone and sees disturbing visions of three boys being stalked at a winter camp. Accompanied by her brother, Finn, they head to the camp to solve the mystery, only to confront the Grabber â€” a killer whoâ€™s grown even more powerful in death.â€
	

	Check out all the new releases hitting theaters this weekend:

title: Mark Ruffalo Saved Woody Harrelson From a Bar Fight After â€˜Now You See Meâ€™ Filming: â€˜A Whole Melee Broke Outâ€™ and Couldâ€™ve Gone â€˜Disastrously Wrongâ€™
description: Mark Ruffalo revealed on the â€œWhere Everybody Knows Your Nameâ€ podcast that he saved Woody Harrelson from an epic bar fight when the two were in New
body:
Mark Ruffalo revealed on the â€œWhere Everybody Knows Your Nameâ€ podcast that he saved Woody Harrelson from an epic bar fight when the two were in New Orleans filming 2013â€™s â€œNow You See Me,â€ Louis Leterrierâ€™s heist thriller about a group of illusionists who carry out robberies. Ruffalo played an FBI agent trying to capture the group.

	â€œWe were shooting â€˜Now You See Meâ€™ in New Orleans, completely on the streets. Totally wild,â€ Ruffalo said (via Entertainment Weekly). â€œCapturing stuff on a long lens, getting dragged into bars during the middle of a scene, like in the middle of Mardi Gras.â€
	

	Ruffalo and Danson stayed out after filming wrapped for the day and went to â€œa packed placeâ€ to grab a drink when things escalated.


	â€œA woman came up to [Woody] and she said, â€˜Oh my God, I love you so much,'â€ Ruffalo said. â€œWoody put his hand on her arm and he said, â€˜Oh, thank you. Thank you, darling.â€™ And this guy comes over and he pushes her outta the way, and he shoves Woody. Bad. Because Woodyâ€™s first response is not â€˜shove someone back,â€™ but â€˜immediately punch them in the face.â€™ Which is the right thing to do, by the way. Itâ€™s the absolute right thing to do. But then a whole melee broke out in this bar. I was in the middle of it and it was turning into aâ€” it was getting to become a whole thingâ€¦ And I grabbed [Woody].â€

	â€œI grabbed [Woody] and I pulled him out,â€ Ruffalo continued. â€œBecause I was like, â€˜This could be fun, but it also just could go so disastrously wrong because you and I might be able to handle ourselves but the rest of the folks we were withâ€¦ I donâ€™t think so.â€
	

	Ruffalo and Harrelson starred in â€œNow You See Meâ€ alongside Jesse Eisenberg, MÃ©lanie Laurent, Isla Fisher, Dave Franco and Morgan Freeman. The movie was a box office hit with $351 million worldwide and spawned a franchise that led to 2016â€™s â€œNow You See Me 2â€ and the upcoming â€œNow You See Me: Now You Donâ€™t,â€ in theaters Nov. 14.

	Watch Ruffaloâ€™s interview on the â€œWhere Everybody Knows Your Nameâ€ podcast in the video below.

schema.headline: Mark Ruffalo Saved Woody Harrelson From a Bar Fight After â€˜Now You See Meâ€™ Filming: â€˜A Whole Melee Broke Outâ€™ and Couldâ€™ve Gone â€˜Disastrously Wrongâ€™

title: Diane Keatonâ€™s Family Reveals Her Cause of Death
description: Diane Keatonâ€˜s family have made a statement revealing her cause of death. Her family thanked fans for their messages of support and told People maga
body:
Diane Keatonâ€˜s family have made a statement revealing her cause of death. Her family thanked fans for their messages of support and told People magazine that the actress died of pneumonia on Saturday.

	â€œThe Keaton family are very grateful for the extraordinary messages of love and support they have received these past few days on behalf of their beloved Diane, who passed away from pneumonia on October 11,â€ the statement said.


	The family suggested that her fans could make donations in her memory to a local food bank or an animal shelter. â€œShe loved her animals and she was steadfast in her support of the unhoused community, so any donations in her memory to a local food bank or an animal shelter would be a wonderful and much appreciated tribute to her,â€ the family told People.
	

	Keaton died in Los Angeles on Saturday. Paramedics had responded to her home and transported her to a nearby hospital.

	A friend said her health had â€œdeclined very suddenlyâ€ in the past few months, according to People, and that only her close family was aware, and chose â€œto keep things very private.â€ 

	Since Saturday, tributes have poured in from her co-stars and friends for the Oscar-winning actress, who in addition to starring in dozens of notable films was known as a passionate architectural preservationist and animal lover. Starting on Friday, AMC Theatres will be rereleasing â€œAnnie Hallâ€ and â€œSomethingâ€™s Gotta Giveâ€ for one week runs to commemorate her memory. Keaton won the best actress Oscar for Woody Allenâ€™s â€œAnnie Hallâ€ and was nominated for best actress for â€œReds,â€ â€œSomethingâ€™s Gotta Giveâ€ and â€œMarvinâ€™s Room.â€

schema.headline: Diane Keatonâ€™s Family Reveals Her Cause of Death

title: â€˜Gen Vâ€™ Actor Keeya King on Annabethâ€™s Heartbreaking Confession to Marie Amid Cipher Reveal
description:
SPOILER ALERT: This story contains spoilers for Season 2, Episode 7 of â€œGen V,â€ now streaming on Amazonâ€™s Prime Video.

	It turns out Marie (Jaz Sin
body:
SPOILER ALERT: This story contains spoilers for Season 2, Episode 7 of â€œGen V,â€ now streaming on Amazonâ€™s Prime Video.

	It turns out Marie (Jaz Sinclair) had a very good reason for originally thinking Dean Cipher (Hamish Linklater) had no powers: He doesnâ€™t.

	Toward the end of this weekâ€™s episode of â€œGen V,â€ Marie, her sister Annabeth (Keeya King), Cate (Maddie Phillips) and Emma (Lizze Broadway) look on in horror as they discover the elderly burn victim man they correctly assumed was Thomas Godolkin (Ethan Slater) has been controlling Cipher this whole time. It wasnâ€™t Cipher who had the power to control others, it was Thomas Godolkin. And from his hyperbaric chamber, Godolkin was controlling the man known as Cipher (who has no powers at all), and jumping in and out of othersâ€™ bodies as well, while he remained on life support. 
	

	Until, that is, Marie brought the century-old supe back to fighting form on this weekâ€™s â€œGen V,â€ in the hopes thatThomas Godolkin would help them stop Cipher. But too bad, he is Cipher! Now, Marie and Annabeth have Godolkinâ€™s pending massacre plans to deal with, on top of trying to mend their fragile sibling relationship: Annabeth confesses she knew Marie was going to kill their parents by accident before it happened, and itâ€™s haunted her ever since.




	

					Jaz Sinclair as Marie Moreau and Keeya King as Annabeth Moreau in â€œGen Vâ€ 
									Jasper Savage/Prime
	



	â€œSheâ€™s been completely removed from the supes, living with her Aunt Pam, and she thinks that supes are monsters. She doesnâ€™t fully grasp her powers, nor does she really understand them,â€ King told Variety abiut playing Marieâ€™s precog sister.
	

	And in her confusion over what happened to them and their parents, Annabethâ€™s pain and shame after their deaths turned into resentment toward Marie â€” she chose to blame her sister for something Annabeth knew was not Marieâ€™s fault.

	The twist in the sistersâ€™ story raises the stakes for not only Marie and Annabeth, but also for Cate, Emma, Jordan (Derek Luh/London Thor), Sam (Asa Germann) and Polarity (Sean Patrick Thomas) going into the â€œGen Vâ€ Season 2 finale next week. It shifts the perspective from what the audience saw in the opening scene of Season 1 â€”Â the deaths of Marie and Annabethâ€™s parents â€” and revealed thatÂ Marie is not solely responsible for her parentsâ€™ deaths. Annabeth could have said something and stopped it.



	

					Hamish Linklater as Dean Cipher in â€œGen Vâ€ 
									Jasper Savage/Prime
	



	â€œIâ€™ve watched the show, and Iâ€™m like, â€˜OK, Annabeth thinks that Marie killed her parents,'â€ King said. â€œAnd then when I sat down with our showrunner, Michelle, she actually explained to me the path that the writers had for Annabeth, which is that she actually had these visions and sheâ€™s been holding onto them for a very long time. 

	â€œAs an actor, itâ€™s sort of weaving in little moments of pain and regret of not acting on those visions, and then also sort of blaming my sister as well,â€ she continued. â€œBecause when youâ€™re upset with yourself, sometimes itâ€™s like, â€˜Where do I place that hurt?â€™ So sometimes she does place it on Marie, her sister.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Gen Vâ€™ Actor Keeya King on Annabethâ€™s Heartbreaking Confession to Marie Amid Cipher Reveal

title: CNNâ€™s Town Hall With Bernie Sanders and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Airs Tonight: Hereâ€™s How to Stream the Event Live Online
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	As the U.
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	As the U.S. government shutdown drags into a second week, CNN is putting on a high-stakes event: â€œShutdown America: A CNN Town Hall with Bernie Sanders and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.â€ The live broadcast airs Wednesday, Oct. 15 at 9 p.m. ET from Washington, D.C., moderated by Kaitlan Collins.

	For those without cable, the best way to stream the town hall live online is through Sling TVâ€™s Orange plan. The plan includes CNN as part of its core channel lineup, giving subscribers access to the broadcast as it airs in real time. Unlike traditional cable, Sling doesnâ€™t require a long-term contract, making it a flexible option for viewers who want to tune in for major events like this one. It can be streamed from smart TVs, tablets, phones or laptops, and subscribers can start or cancel at any time.
	

	To watch the town hall live, users can sign up for Sling TVâ€™s Orange plan, confirm that CNN is included in their channel lineup and log in through the Sling app or website before the 9 p.m. ET broadcast begins. You can also sign up for a $4.99 Sling Day Pass to stream the Town Hall live without the commitment.


	With more than a million federal employees affected and essential services under strain, the town hall will feature questions from Democrats, Republicans, independents, and those personally impacted by the shutdown. CNN has made a point of emphasizing the open format, allowing Sanders and Ocasio-Cortez to engage with viewers about how the standoff in Washington is reverberating nationwide.

schema.headline: CNNâ€™s Town Hall With Bernie Sanders and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Airs Tonight: Hereâ€™s How to Stream the Event Live Online

title: Michael J. Fox Met With Eric Stoltz for the First Time, 40 Years After â€˜Back to the Futureâ€™ Recasting: We Discovered It â€˜Had Not Made Us Enemies or Rivalsâ€™
description: Michael J. Fox reveals in his new memoir, â€œFuture Boy,â€ that he wrote a letter to Eric Stoltz asking to finally meet 40 years after Fox replaced Sto
body:
Michael J. Fox reveals in his new memoir, â€œFuture Boy,â€ that he wrote a letter to Eric Stoltz asking to finally meet 40 years after Fox replaced Stoltz as Marty McFly in the blockbuster â€œBack to the Future.â€ As the infamous story goes, Stoltz was already in production for six weeks on the Robert Zemeckis-directed blockbuster when the decision was made to boot him and recast the lead role with the directorâ€™s first choice, Fox, who had been blocked from the film due to his commitment to the NBC sitcom â€œFamily Ties.â€
	

	â€œEric has maintained his silence on the subject for 40 years, so I was prepared for the likelihood that heâ€™d prefer to keep it that way,â€ Fox writes in the memoir (via Entertainment Weekly), noting the two had never come face to face to discuss the casting swap. Fox wrote to him: â€œIf your answer is â€˜piss off and leave me aloneâ€™â€¦ That works, too.â€


	Stoltz responded with a â€œbeautifully written replyâ€ that â€œbegan, â€˜Piss off and leave me alone!â€™ Thankfully, this was followed by â€˜I jestâ€¦â€™ Eric was thoughtful about my outreach, and although he respectfully declined to participate in the book, he seemed open to the idea of getting together.â€

	When Fox and Stoltz finally found themselves together in the same room, the actors â€œimmediately fell into an easy dialogue about our careers, families, and yes, our own trips through the space-time continuum,â€ Fox writes. â€œ[Stoltz entered] with a smile, and we quickly acknowledged that neither of us had an issue with the other. What transpired on â€˜Back to the Futureâ€™ had not made us enemies or fated rivals; we were just two dedicated actors who had poured equal amounts of energy into the same role. The rest had nothing to do with us. As it turned out, we had much more in common than our spin as Marty.â€
	

	â€œIn the months since meeting, Eric and I have maintained a friendly correspondence â€“ volleys back and forth between like-minded actors and dads, offering up recent movies weâ€™ve loved, the latest adventures with our kids and an occasional detour into politics,â€ Fox adds. â€œHis emails are reliably witty and always fun to read [and] a reminder that some of the best parts of our future can come from the past.â€

	Replacing Stoltz as Marty McFly in â€œBack to the Futureâ€ changed the course of Foxâ€™s career, as he made the jump from sitcom star to blockbuster actor. The movie grossed $381.1Â million worldwide in 1985 to become theÂ yearâ€™s highest-grossing movie and spawned a franchise that led to 1989â€™s â€œBack to the Future Part IIâ€ and 1990â€™s â€œBack to the Future Part III,â€ both of which Fox headlined.

	In his memoir, Fox writes that â€œFamily Tiesâ€ creator Gary David Goldberg â€œremoved me from considerationâ€ to play Marty McFly when Zemeckis and producer Steven Spielberg wanted to originally cast him. The film â€œhad already shot for over a monthâ€ and the dailies with Stoltz front and center â€œwere disappointingâ€ to the creative team.

	â€œEric was an immensely talented actor, but the creative team felt that he just wasnâ€™t the right fit for Marty McFly,â€ Fox notes.

	Foxâ€™s memoir, â€œFuture Boy,â€ is now available for purchase.

schema.headline: Michael J. Fox Met With Eric Stoltz for the First Time, 40 Years After â€˜Back to the Futureâ€™ Recasting: We Discovered It â€˜Had Not Made Us Enemies or Rivalsâ€™

title: â€˜McBee Dynastyâ€™ Renewed for Season 3 at Bravo, Set to Start Filming This Week as Patriarch Steve Is Sentenced for Fraud (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Oct 15, 2025 3:00pm PT	
	

	
		â€˜McBee Dynastyâ€™ Renewed for Season 3 at Bravo, Set to Start Filming This Week as Patriarch Steve Is Sen
body:
Oct 15, 2025 3:00pm PT	
	

	
		â€˜McBee Dynastyâ€™ Renewed for Season 3 at Bravo, Set to Start Filming This Week as Patriarch Steve Is Sentenced for Fraud (EXCLUSIVE)
	
	
			


			
			
	

									Courtesy of Paul Andrews/Bravo
	

		
	
				

	Bravo has renewed its viral hit â€œThe McBee Dynasty: Real American Cowboysâ€ for a third season, and will begin filming ahead of the Oct. 16 sentencing of family patriarch Steve McBee Sr. The show â€” which is as if â€œThe Righteous Gemstonesâ€ and â€œSuccessionâ€ had a reality baby â€” moved to Bravo from Peacock for its second season, and found success there.

	In November 2024, McBee pleaded guilty in federal court to â€”Â according to a Department of Justice press release â€”Â a â€œmulti-million dollar fraud scheme involving federal crop insurance benefits he was not entitled to receiveâ€ from 2018 through 2020. In other words, he falsified reports for the familyâ€™s Gallatin, Mo., farm in order to receive subsidies and insurance payments they werenâ€™t authorized to get. In a memo from Oct. 6, prosecutors asked U.S. District Court Judge Stephen R. Bough to sentence McBee to 41 months in prison, followed by three years of supervised release and more than $4 million in restitution.

	On the show, the economics of McBee Farming Operations are always presented as precarious. Because of these legal problems, McBee appeared only twice in the showâ€™s second season, after taking center stage in Season 1.



	

	



	According to ratings provided by Bravo, Season 2 of â€œTheÂ McBeeÂ Dynastyâ€ â€”Â which ran from June 30-Sept. 1 â€” averaged 1.3 million weekly viewers across platforms. Compared with Season 1, its ratings were up 82% on Peacock and 213% on DVR. The second half of the 10-episode season showed gains ofÂ +16% on PeacockÂ andÂ +8%Â on Bravo through seven-day viewership. In an interesting statistic, about one-third of the second seasonâ€™s â€œMcBeeâ€ audience, Bravo says, â€œco-viewed with someone else on both Bravo and Peacock, making it aÂ Top 4 Original Series of 2025Â on both platforms â€“ fueled by female viewers watching with male viewers.â€


	In Steve McBee Sr.â€™s absence, the second season focused on Steven Jr. and his brothersÂ Jesse McBeeÂ andÂ Cole, as they tried to save the farm and engaged in their messy personal lives. The showâ€™s official logline reads, â€œOn the heels of a wedding and the arrival of two new babies, theÂ McBeeÂ clan is growing â€”Â and so are the challenges of balancing love, legacy, and life on the ranch.â€

	â€œTheÂ McBeeÂ Dynastyâ€Â is produced by Jeff Jenkins Productions, in association with 3BMG. Jenkins, Russell Jay-Staglik, Luke Neslage, Brandon Beck, Ross Weintraub and Reinout Oerlemans executive produce.â€¯Â Â 



	
		More from Variety

schema.headline: â€˜McBee Dynastyâ€™ Renewed for Season 3 at Bravo, Set to Start Filming This Week as Patriarch Steve Is Sentenced for Fraud (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Stumbleâ€™ Trailer: Jenn Lyon Rallies an Underdog Cheer Squad in New NBC Comedy (TV News Roundup)
description:
NBC has released the official trailer and first look photos of Jenn Lyon as a down and out cheerleading coach in NBCâ€™s comedy series, â€œStumble.â€

	T
body:
NBC has released the official trailer and first look photos of Jenn Lyon as a down and out cheerleading coach in NBCâ€™s comedy series, â€œStumble.â€

	The series takes place in the world of competitive cheerleading, with the official logline describing it as â€œa mockumentary about the ridiculously high stakes competitive world of junior college cheer.â€

	In addition to Lyon, the cast includes Taran Killam, Ryan Pinkston, Jarrett Austin Brown, Anissa Borrego, Arianna Davis, Taylor Dunbar and Georgie Murphy. Kristin Chenoweth will appear as a recurring guest star.
	

	â€œStumbleâ€ comes from writers and executive producers Jeff Astrof and Liz Astrof. Dana Honor is also executive producing through Defining Eve Productions alongside Monica Aldama, retired cheerleading coach and star of the Netflix docuseries â€œCheer.â€ Jeff Blitz directed and executive produced the pilot. Universal Television is the studio.


	The series is set to premiere on Friday, Nov. 7, at 8:30 p.m. ET/PT on NBC. Episodes will be available to stream the next day on Peacock.

	Check out the trailer and first look images for â€œStumbleâ€ below:






	

									Matt Miller/NBC
	





	

									Matt Miller/NBC
	


	
		TRAILERS	

	HBO Max and Cartoon Network Studios have unveiled the first trailer for Season 2 ofâ€œAdventure Time: Fionna and Cake,â€ set to release on Oct. 23 on HBO Max. The ten-episode season will drop weekly through Dec. 25.

	Season 2 will follow Fionna and Cake after their journey through the multiverse, where they must tackle new adventures while Huntress Wizard â€œembarks on a quest with fatal consequences.â€
	

	â€œAdventure Time: Fionna and Cakeâ€ stars: Madeleine Martin, Roz Ryan, and Ashly Burch, with recurring guest cast Anna Akana, Dee Bradley Baker, Maria Bamford, Matthew Broderick, Frank Collison, Andy Daly, Grey DeLisle, Harvey GuillÃ©n, Patti Harrison, Manny Jacinto, Tom Kenny, Kris Kollins, Marc Maron, Jinkx Monsoon, Kumail Nanjiani, Olivia Olson, Vico Ortiz, Chelsea Peretti, Jeremy Shada, Hynden Walch, and Pendleton Ward, among others.

	Watch the trailer for Season 2 of â€œAdventure Time: Fionna and Cakeâ€ below.

 


	*

	Oxygen has unveiled three trailers for a trio of series set to debut on the network on Nov. 9. The night of killer new programming kicks off with season three of â€œSnapped: Behind Bars,â€ â€œKiller Relationship with Faith Jenkinsâ€ and â€œKiller Grannies,â€ hosted by June Squibb.

	The third season of â€œSnapped: Behind Barsâ€ takes â€œviewers behind prison walls to meet convicted individuals featured on â€œSnapped,â€ who are now willing to discuss their cases.â€Â 

	Season four of â€œKiller Relationship with Faith Jenkinsâ€ will center around complex relationships that end in untimely tragedy, with Jenkins giving her professional perspective on various cases.

	â€œKiller Granniesâ€ will â€œchronicle cases involving a killer no one would suspect: Grandma. Through gripping archival footage, selective recreations and in-depth interviews with investigators, prosecutors, friends and family, every episode will peel back the plastic cover on the couch to uncover why and how these maternal matriarchs of the family can turn deadly.â€

	Watch the trailers for â€œSnapped: Behind Bars,â€ â€œKiller Relationship with Faith Jenkins,â€ and â€œKiller Granniesâ€ below.










	*

	Netflix has unveiled the official trailer for Michelle Wolfâ€™s new comedy special, â€œMichelle Wolf: The Well,â€ which premieres globally on Oct. 21.

	According to the official synopsis, Wolfâ€™s comedy special â€œgets real about white women, serial killers and adjusting to motherhood â€” blending fearless honesty with her trademark wit and social insight.â€ The special is her first new hour for Netflix since â€œJoke Showâ€ and follows her 2023 special, â€œItâ€™s Great to Be Here.â€
	

	Check out the trailer for â€œMichelle Wolf: The Wellâ€ below:



	
		EXECUTIVE NEWS	

	Rena Ayer has been named senior vice president of content and talent partnerships at Red Seat Ventures, in which she will report to Chris Balfe, founder and CEO.

	Ayer will be responsible for developing and overseeing Red Seat Venturesâ€™ portfolio of content partnerships and roster of marquee talent relationships. 

	â€œRena is a dynamic media executive with a wealth of experience, and weâ€™re excited to welcome her to our team,â€ Balfe said in a statement. â€œHer entrepreneurial grit, sharp business acumen and operational excellence make Rena the perfect fit as we continue to scale our content businesses.â€

	With more than a decade of media experience, Ayer was responsible for driving growth and scaling partnerships during her tenures at Sirius XM and Audible.Â In her previous roles, she has launched innovative subscription models, expanded global platforms and forged alliances with top creators and brands.Â 

	Red Seat Ventures develops media properties by partnering with market-leading talents, brands and personalities. The company offers investment capital, technology and skilled management to help launch new businesses.
	
		AWARDS	

	NYC Media, the broadcast network and production group for the City of New York, received five awards at the 68th Annual New York Emmys for the first season of its original series, â€œThe NYC Field Guide: How to Thrive in the Five.â€Â 

	The awards include:Â 


Business/Consumer (Short Or Long Form Content)
Promotion/Non-news â€“ Program Promotion (Single Shot)
Editor â€“ Long Form Content, Lighting â€“ Studio/Location
Program Host/ModeratorÂ 



	As part of the Mayorâ€™s Office of Media and Entertainment (MOME), NYC Media will see the debut of four new programs in October such as â€œA Manhattan Fantasy,â€ following the creation of Fort Tryon Park and The Met Cloisters, â€œBeauty Passport NYC,â€ an exploration of New Yorkâ€™s beauty culture, â€œSheroes,â€ a weekly radio program created, hosted, and produced by Carmel Holt, that spotlights womenâ€™s voices on the airwaves and in music and â€œWow, I Never Knew That!,â€ a series focusing on various different facts and origins â€œbehind the stuff you are already familiar with.â€

	Season two of â€œThe NYC Field Guide: How to Thrive in the Fiveâ€ is now in production.Â 
	
	
		PARTNERSHIPS	

	Fawesome, a free ad-supported streaming platform, will expand its Spanish-language content library through new partnerships with Latin American and international distributors.

	The expansion reinforces its parent company, Future Todayâ€™s, continued investment in serving Hispanic audiences in the U.S. Fawesomeâ€™s new content includes telenovelas, classic Mexican movies, trending Turkish and Korean dramas, reality competitions and inspirational religious series from partnerships withÂ  TV Azteca, Carcacol, Cisneros, Hemisphere, Intermedya and Olympusat.Â 

	Additionally, multiple FAST channels have been added to the service, such as Caracol Mix, Teleonce and Bein Sports. More recently, Future Today collaborated with Jorge Balleste, a veteran executive within Spanish-language programming and audience engagement, to help expand the company.Â 

	Formerly of TelevisaUnivision, Balleste has helped spearhead the companyâ€™s growth in Hispanic markets, working closely with Di Lorenzo to identify, acquire and program content that authentically reflects the tastes and preferences of Hispanic viewers across the U.S.

title: Legendary Actress Diane Keaton's Cause of Death Revealed
description:
Diane Keaton
                          Cause Of Death Revealed
body:
Diane Keaton
                          Cause Of Death Revealed
                      
                  
                        Published October 15, 2025 5:03 PM PDT
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Diane Keatonâ€™s cause of death has been revealed -- the legendary actress passed away from pneumonia.
      
    
          Diane's family revealed the cause of death in a statement to PEOPLE, saying ... "The Keaton family are very grateful for the extraordinary messages of love and support they have received these past few days on behalf of their beloved Diane, who passed away from pneumonia on October 11."
      
    
          The family added ... "She loved her animals and she was steadfast in her support of the unhoused community, so any donations in her memory to a local food bank or an animal shelter would be a wonderful and much appreciated tribute to her."
      

          Diane died October 11 ... and as TMZ first reported, the L.A. Fire Dept. paramedics responded to her home around 8:08 AM Saturday, transporting one person -- confirmed by sources as Keaton -- to a nearby hospital.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    Broadcastify.com
          
    
          Dispatch audio caught responders calling a "person down" at her address.
      
    
          The icon is survived by her adopted children -- 25-year-old son, Duke, and 29-year-old daughter, Dexter.
      
    
          She was 79.
      
    
          RIP

title: Brianna LaPaglia Says She's Thriving Post-Zach Bryan, But Not Dating
description:
Brianna LaPaglia
                          I'm Single & Thriving Post-Zach
body:
Brianna LaPaglia
                          I'm Single & Thriving Post-Zach
                          ... Dating Can Wait!!!
                      
                  
                        Published October 15, 2025 2:03 PM PDT
                                                                      |
                Updated October 15, 2025 3:48 PM PDT
                                    
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          Brianna "Chickenfry" LaPaglia is looking back on her rocky split from Zach Bryan ... saying sheâ€™s thriving now, and when it comes to dating ... thatâ€™s not even on the menu.
      
    
          We ran into the Barstool Sports star in NYC Wednesday, and she tells us the past year has been all about healing ... sheâ€™s in a fantastic headspace now and spilled on everything sheâ€™s been up to since kicking Zach to the curb.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          We also asked Brianna about the multimillion-dollar NDA Zach allegedly put in front of her -- which she flat-out refused to sign -- and she says anyone in her shoes should trust their gut and take their power back.
      

      
        
              
    
    
          Catch the full clip ... â€™cause Brianna, who also accused the country singer of emotional abuse, drops some straight-up wisdom on surviving toxic relationships ... and why staying true to yourself is always the best move.
      
    
          But for now, she's booked and busy ... making it crystal clear she's off the dating scene -- and it'll probably stay that way for a good while!
      
    
          Brianna can also be seen competing as a celebrity recruit on "Special Forces: Worldâ€™s Toughest Test" airing Thursdays on FOX and next day Hulu.

title: Construction Worker Nearly Saws Himself in Half, on Video
description:
Construction Worker
                          Now That's A Little Prick!!!
body:
Construction Worker
                          Now That's A Little Prick!!!
                      
                  
                        Published October 15, 2025 12:10 PM PDT
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    NewsX/Joe Golder
          
    
          A construction worker in China nearly disemboweled himself with a cutting saw as he was slicing through tiles on a wall ... and video shows just how lucky he is to be alive.
      
    
          Footage shows the worker using a huge circular saw at a job site, when he suddenly loses control of the machine ... the saw slips, bounces off the wall, goes over his head and he turns, falls and lands on the blade guard as the saw keeps spinning.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As you can see, the guy narrowly avoided a much worse fate here ... he easily could have been sawed in half.
      

          The incident went down last week in Lianjiang City in China's Guangdong Province ... and local media reports the guy only suffered a half-centimeter deep wound that missed all his vital organs.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The man in the video -- only identified as Mr. Huang -- told reporters he'd worked as a wall cutter for at least 7 years ... and after this accident, he's going to start using a smaller saw to improve safety.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Insane Videos
              
                          
                Viral

schema.headline: Construction Worker Nearly Saws Himself in Half, on Video
